doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Multiple Surprises from Quick Commerce Multiple Surprises from Quick Commerce_2025-08-31

passages.text: China (PRC) | Internet

Highlights include (1) synergies generated by BABA in Quick Commerce (QC) include GMV, traffic, CMR and engagement on strong flywheel effects; (2) BABA's QC daily order volume is sustainable. We estimate UE losses to reduce by half in next two months; (3) food delivery market shares by volume of MT/BABA were close in Aug; (4) UE loss peaked in Jul for MT/BABA and improved MoM in Aug; (4) Long- term UE of food delivery to be RMB1.0 as new norm.

BABA: a number of synergies generated in Quick Commerce (QC). Strong flywheel effects are generated in user, merchants and riders. These include (1) Monthly active users for QC reached 300m in Aug (3x vs Apr) and drove Taobao mobile app MAU/DAU increase of 25%/20% YoY; (2) CMR benefits from increase in traffic, users and purchase frequency from QC. We expect about 2- 3 ppt benefits to CMR in future; (3) GMV for traditional ecommerce is expected to benefit from QC; (4) incremental RMB1tn to be generated from QC in next three years (FY28); (5) 1m branded offline stores are expected to join instant commerce over time.

Takeaways on QC from BABA/MT/JD earnings results. These include (1) food delivery sector is reshaped and enlarged with entry of BABA and JD. Long- term UE of food delivery is expected to be RMB1.0 as the new norm; (2) MT and BABA market shares by order volume were close in Aug. In terms of GMV, there is still a gap between MT and BABA in market share; (3) UE losses peaked for MT / BABA in Jul and both saw improvement in Aug vs Jul; (4) We factor in higher losses for QC (food and non- food) for MT/BABA in 3Q at (RMB17bn)/(RMB30bn) respectively; (5) We expect UE of BABA's QC to improve significantly in Sep and reduce by half after two months, thanks to user structure optimization, order mix and fulfillment efficiencies. AOV of BABA's food delivery is about 20% less vs MT with former's beverage volume less than 30% of total QC orders; (6) JD held up well in order volume in Jul vs Jun with emphasis on UE; (7) MT swung into a loss for food delivery in 2Q due to heightening competition in Jun is not expected by market, while BABA posted in- line in China ecommerce.

Food delivery: market shares by volume of MT/BABA close in Aug. In 3Q, we estimate MT food delivery orders to grow by about 13% YoY with average daily orders reaching 75m. For BABA, we estimate more than 80% of daily orders from Quick Commerce related to food delivery, implying about 8m daily orders. In terms of AOV, we estimate BABA AOV at 20% less than MT. We expect BABA's food delivery order volume/GMV to be 90%/70% of MT in Aug.

UE loss peaked in Jul for MT/BABA and narrowed MoM in Aug; UE loss for BABA is expected to improve by half over next two months. In terms of UE trends, these include (1) MT and BABA's UE in Aug improved vs Jul. We expect both to have hit peak UE losses in Jul; (2) For MT, we expect it was profitable in Apr and turned to breakeven in May before entering into loss in Jun on 618 marketing campaign; (3) For BABA, we expect the UE loss, which widened between May and Jul, to have narrowed in Aug. UE loss is expected to further narrow significantly in Sep, and halve over the next two months; (4) For JD, it focuses on balance between UE and order volume. UE improved slightly in Jul vs Jun while daily order volume held up well in Jul vs Jun.

We would like to thank Fiona Fan, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report. We would like to thank Han Wang, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report We would like to thank Erica Qiu, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

Our price target of US\\$165/HK\\$160 is based on SOTP valuation. Key risks include (1) severe macroeconomic slowdown impacts online shopping growth; (2) aggressive marketing spending in local services and globalization due to intensified competition; and (3) user growth falls below expectations.

We have a Buy rating and PT of US\\$60/HK\\$233 based on 9.2x 2025E P/E (ex- new business). Key risks include (1) macro headwinds affecting GMV growth, especially in the electronics category; (2) intensified competition leading to margin pressure from aggressive marketing spending in the grocery category; and (3) user base growth in lower- tier cities falling below expectations on poor execution.

We have a Buy rating and PT of HKD139 based on P/E valuation. Risks include: (1) intensifying competitive landscape in food delivery, leading to aggressive subsidies and marketing efforts; (2) user experience is impaired on poor merchant service quality and unreliable user feedback; and (3) new initiatives incur significant losses and affect overall operating results.
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
